intro: Ledebouriella seseloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ledemont, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Its leaves are narrow and serrated, contributing to its distinctive appearance, while its flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
